result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Kenneth Krieser

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license   *Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol

10:49 AM Defendant William Kenneth Krieser appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Frank appears on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Frank states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Frank waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Court notes that the Defendant is in Treatment Court; Atty Frank to speak to his client.

Atty Juech asks for $1,000 signature bond with conditions.
Atty Frank has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol
Status hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
